slides.title: EC2
slides.description: Provides resizable virtual servers in the cloud. It gives full control over compute resources and operating systems. Commonly used for flexible and scalable workloads.

slides.title: Lambda
slides.description: Serverless compute service that runs code in response to events. It automatically scales and charges per execution. Ideal for event-driven and microservice architectures.

slides.title: Elastic Beanstalk
slides.description: Platform-as-a-Service for deploying web applications. It manages infrastructure, scaling, and monitoring. Developers focus mainly on application code.

slides.title: ECS
slides.description: Managed container orchestration service. It allows running Docker containers without managing servers. Integrates tightly with other AWS services.

slides.title: EKS
slides.description: Managed Kubernetes service on AWS. It simplifies running Kubernetes clusters at scale. Used for portable and cloud-native workloads.

slides.title: Lightsail
slides.description: Simplified cloud platform for small applications. It bundles compute, storage, and networking. Ideal for quick deployments and small teams.

slides.title: VPC
slides.description: Isolated virtual network within AWS. It enables control over IP ranges, subnets, and routing. Used for secure networking architectures.

slides.title: Elastic Load Balancer
slides.description: Distributes incoming traffic across multiple targets. It improves fault tolerance and availability. Supports Layer 4 and Layer 7 routing.

slides.title: Route 53
slides.description: Scalable DNS and domain management service. It offers health checks and routing policies. Used for high availability and global routing.

slides.title: CloudFront
slides.description: Global content delivery network service. It caches content closer to users for low latency. Commonly used for web and media delivery.

slides.title: S3
slides.description: Object storage service for virtually unlimited data. It offers high durability and scalability. Used for backups, data lakes, and static content.

slides.title: EBS
slides.description: Block storage for EC2 instances. It provides persistent, high-performance storage. Commonly used for databases and application data.

slides.title: EFS
slides.description: Fully managed file storage service. It supports shared access across multiple instances. Used for scalable file-based workloads.

slides.title: Glacier
slides.description: Low-cost storage for archival data. It is optimized for infrequent access. Used for compliance and long-term backups.

slides.title: RDS
slides.description: Managed relational database service. It supports engines like MySQL, PostgreSQL, and SQL Server. Handles backups, scaling, and patching.

slides.title: Aurora
slides.description: High-performance relational database compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL. It offers improved scalability and availability. Used for enterprise-grade applications.

slides.title: DynamoDB
slides.description: Fully managed NoSQL key-value database. It provides single-digit millisecond performance at scale. Used for high-throughput applications.

slides.title: Redshift
slides.description: Fully managed data warehouse service. It is optimized for large-scale analytics queries. Commonly used in business intelligence workloads.

slides.title: ElastiCache
slides.description: In-memory data store for Redis and Memcached. It improves application performance through caching. Used for low-latency access patterns.

slides.title: SQS
slides.description: Fully managed message queue service. It enables decoupled and asynchronous communication. Used for background processing.

slides.title: SNS
slides.description: Publish-subscribe messaging service. It enables fan-out notifications to multiple subscribers. Commonly used for alerts and event-driven systems.

slides.title: EventBridge
slides.description: Event bus service for application integration. It enables loosely coupled event-driven architectures. Supports SaaS and AWS events.

slides.title: Step Functions
slides.description: Serverless workflow orchestration service. It coordinates multiple AWS services into state machines. Used for complex business processes.

slides.title: API Gateway
slides.description: Fully managed service for creating and managing APIs. It supports REST, HTTP, and WebSocket APIs. Commonly used with Lambda functions.

slides.title: IAM
slides.description: Identity and access management service. It controls permissions and authentication. Used to secure AWS resources.

slides.title: Cognito
slides.description: User identity and authentication service. It supports user sign-up and sign-in. Commonly used for web and mobile applications.

slides.title: Secrets Manager
slides.description: Secure storage for credentials and secrets. It supports automatic rotation. Used to protect sensitive application data.

slides.title: KMS
slides.description: Managed encryption key service. It enables data encryption at rest and in transit. Integrated with most AWS services.

slides.title: CloudWatch
slides.description: Monitoring and observability service. It collects metrics, logs, and alarms. Used to maintain system health.

slides.title: CloudTrail
slides.description: Tracks API activity and account changes. It provides audit logs for governance. Used for security and compliance.

slides.title: X-Ray
slides.description: Distributed tracing service. It helps analyze and debug microservices. Used for performance optimization.

slides.title: CloudFormation
slides.description: Infrastructure as code service. It allows provisioning AWS resources using templates. Used for repeatable deployments.

slides.title: CodeCommit
slides.description: Managed Git-based source control service. It integrates with AWS security and tooling. Used for private repositories.

slides.title: CodeBuild
slides.description: Fully managed build service. It compiles code and runs tests. Used in CI pipelines.

slides.title: CodeDeploy
slides.description: Automates application deployments. It supports EC2, Lambda, and containers. Reduces deployment downtime.

slides.title: CodePipeline
slides.description: Continuous integration and delivery service. It automates build, test, and deploy stages. Used for DevOps workflows.

slides.title: Athena
slides.description: Serverless interactive query service. It analyzes data directly in S3 using SQL. Used for ad-hoc analytics.

slides.title: Glue
slides.description: Managed ETL service for data integration. It prepares and transforms data for analytics. Commonly used in data lakes.

slides.title: Lake Formation
slides.description: Data lake management and security service. It simplifies data ingestion and access control. Used for governed analytics.

slides.title: QuickSight
slides.description: Business intelligence and visualization service. It provides interactive dashboards. Used for data-driven insights.

slides.title: SageMaker
slides.description: End-to-end machine learning platform. It supports model building, training, and deployment. Used for scalable ML workloads.

slides.title: Rekognition
slides.description: Image and video analysis service. It detects objects, faces, and text. Used for computer vision applications.

slides.title: Comprehend
slides.description: Natural language processing service. It extracts insights from text. Used for sentiment and entity analysis.

slides.title: Textract
slides.description: Automated document text extraction service. It analyzes scanned documents and forms. Used for document processing.

slides.title: Bedrock
slides.description: Managed service for foundation models. It enables generative AI without infrastructure management. Used for AI-powered applications.
